newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares ease, dealers divided.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares ease, dealers divided.

text.p: Lithuanian share indices slid in slow trading Friday, and brokers were divided over whether activity would pick up next week.

"I don't think turnover will rise next week," said Robertas Berzinskas, a broker with Vilniaus Bank. "I expect the situation next week to be very similar to this week, and I don't see anything to suggest that turnover would go up."
The index of the official list of shares slipped a tiny 0.36 point to 922.15 points. Group A shares fell 21.12 points to 1989.53 points.
Despite the fall, some brokers remained optimistic.
"Today there's a good mood on the market because the most popular share prices moved up," said Tomas Andrejauskas, a broker with Suprema.
Andrejauskas said the sliding indices were due to the fact that Lithuanian Gas and Lithuanian Energy were both down while Klaipeda Stevedoring Company (KLASCO) stayed the same at 11.50 litas.
"We had good trading today. The prices moved up a little today and I think turnover will follow on Monday," Andrejauskas said.
Lithuanian Gas was down only slightly, to 1.80 litas from 1.81 litas. Lithuanian Energy fell to 2.35 litas from 2.45 litas.
Turnover on the central market was a paltry 480,000 litas while block trades accounted for 1.5 million litas, down from 4.6 million litas on Thursday.
Hermis Bank led block trades, turning over 676,000 litas at a price of 169.00 litas.
"Hermis Bank said three months ago that they would buy their own shares," one broker said. "I think they might be buying them."
Hermis traded at 175.10 litas on the central market in low volume of 8,700 litas.
